content:
Am I the only one who has an untracked lakefile.olean?

I imagine that the source is #20795, where I missed this issue.
Just delete it. I got one recently when I was reviewing an old PR!
Also happened to me. Just remove lakefile.olean, as well as build and lake-packages, which are just remnants of an old time and not useful anymore.
Ah, I did remove the others, but for some reason I thought that the lakefile.olean was still useful.
Sorry, I cleaned up the .gitignore file just recently, so these are now showing up. Hopefully this only affects ... old-timers. :-)
It affected me on Monday when we went through PRs on the queue which had been there the longest FWIW
I have had *.olean in my global git ignore forever: https://github.com/Julian/dotfiles/blob/main/.config/git/ignore#L114 in case anyone's sufficiently bothered and isn't aware that's an option.
